location.venue_address: R. Rodrigues de Faria 103 edifício H 0.10B

venue.venue_name: Restaurant Café Domino Bern El Husseini

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 160 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 33!

items.checkin_comment:
[31.1.14] Start is malty, sweet, watery. More watery than sweet. Taste is a bit like green vegetables… probably due to the "nature identical malt flavour"…. 
The aftertaste is not better - even worse. Very abrupt ending - no aftertaste at all.

[8.6.15] Smooth and neutral beginning. Very watery with hints of raspberries in the aftertaste. A bit artificial, not too sweet with lots of water. No bitterness and only hints of beer in the background. Not better than water with hints of raspberries.

items.badge_description: Just because it’s non-alcoholic doesn’t mean it’s not good. Sometimes duty calls and you’ve got to be ready! That's 175 different beverages with the style of Non-Alcoholic. Try 5 more for Level 36!

items.checkin_comment:
[27.3.16] Fresh fruity peach aroma. Not too deep, not much beer in the background. Easy to drink and refreshing, not too sweet with a slightly artificial peach aftertaste. 
 Nice but too less beer.
[17.1.14] the beer starts smooth, a bit grainy. Slightly watery. The main part is more bitter than expected but very smooth. In the aftertaste slightly grainy, smooth-malty and nice bitter.
Kinda if Heineken and Red Stripe had a baby.￼

items.badge_description:
Bad weather? Strike? Flight delayed? Head over to the nearest bar and kill some time! 

That's a beer at 5 different venues categorized as an Airport! Try 5 more different ones for Level 2!
Travel much? You must be a "brewsetter". That's at least a beer from 10 different countries. Try 5 more for Level 3!
Light and crisp, a Pilsner is all you need to make your day great. Though, perhaps another one would make it even better. That’s 5 different Pilsners. Try 5 more for Level 2!

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 480 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.
One cannot live on dank hops alone. Tone down the bitterness and enjoy some smooth flavor. That's 285 different beers with an IBU of 20 or below.  Try 5 more for Level 58!

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 65 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 14!
Travel much? You must be a "brewsetter". That's at least a beer from 20 different countries. Try 5 more for Level 5!
Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 75 distinct venues!

It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That's 360 check-ins with a photo.  Try 5 more for Level 73!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 190 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 39!
Happy Untappd anniversary to you! Thanks for sticking around and drinking socially with us. Cheers! That's 2 years on Untappd!

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 115 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 24!
Light and crisp, a Pilsner is all you need to make your day great. Though, perhaps another one would make it even better. That’s 20 different Pilsners. Try 5 more for Level 5!

beer.beer_description: A specialty dark beer brewed with 100% malted barley having a 6% alcohol level. Its creamy foam enhances the tantalizing rich aroma, offering a memorable drinking experience. The unique taste of this distinctive beer is most appreciated when sipped from a glass and shared during gatherings with special people

There are two beers called Al Rayess by the same brewer. One has a label with the brand name in Arabic, containing 5% alcohol, while this one has a label with the brand name in Latin letters and contains 4,5% alcohol
